nodes.bodyText: Is this really correct? I would have expected an "/" instead of "_" here. But I'm not a java developer :)

nodes.bodyText: The name of the symlinks is generated automatically by build-jar-repository from the directory name + the jar name.

nodes.bodyText: So if I understand correctly, the symlinks will not change, but in the code you are accessing them via the new path now. Right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,5 @@
+- Fix symlinks for gson, httcomponents on Leap 15.2
+

nodes.bodyText:
So, the build will use the gson and httpcomponets jars from Leap instead of the same jars from Uyuni (which have been removed anyways). Previously the build used the gson and httpcomponents packages from Uyuni but at install time the packages from Leap were installed.
Tomcat and Taskomatic load the jars referenced via the symlinks in /srv/tomcat/webapps/rhn/WEB-INF/lib and /usr/share/spacewalk/taskomatic. Since the symlinks for these jars were broken both Tomcat and Taskomatic failed to start.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,5 @@
+- Fix symlinks for gson, httcomponents on Leap 15.2
+
